title: Cyrus
author: Cyrus
created_time: February 17, 2023, 02:12:50 PMLast edit: August 22, 2023, 12:39:54 PM by Cyrus
content: First of all, congratulations to the winners of the Bitcointalk Community Awards 2022. The event already reached it's 3rd edition. We'd also like to thank icopress for organizing the event and everyone else that sponsored the event by donating their time, knowledge, money or a combination of them.And of course, thank you to everyone that helped make this place what it is today, with it's ups and downs and everything in between. It literally wouldn't be the same without you!As some of you might know, Cryptios pledged to sponsor the event with a physical prize consisting in a special edition of the Open Mic Forum artwork. The original piece was commissioned by us from likehiro of Hard Fork Studio, which you might remember from his awesome entry in the 10th anniversary art contest.This thread serves as a reference and a way to present the print before contacting the winners to ask if they want to claim this prize. Thank you Fillippone for letting us showcase your print here.Click the image for high res.The Bitcointalk forum, as Bitcoin itself, is a very open place where each of us has a voice. the Open Mic Forum is a visual representation example of that statement.This edition is a limited run of at most 12 prints, one for each category of the BCA22 (a digital high res file is available if for privacy or whatever reason you decline the physical prize, it's fine, we understand!)DetailsGiclée fine art print on Hahnemuehle PhotoRag Bright White, 310 gsm.Size: 60cm/24'' wide, unframed.Due to the cost of these prints, we will print them based on confirmation from the winners.This item is not for sale, it is a 1 of 1 print for the winners of Bitcointalk Community Awards 2022. Another edition of this artwork will be available for purchase later + a surprize item.

comments.author: 3dOOm
comments.created_time: February 17, 2023, 02:20:09 PMLast edit: August 22, 2023, 12:43:39 PM by 3dOOm
comments.body: Congrats to all winners and special thanks to the organizer, we hope that all winners could enjoy physical prices but we understand regarding privacy and so on. Also thanks to likehero for this beautiful design, hope you guys and miss will like it!. We were very much pleased to see the how many people liked the Bitcoin Sunrise stamp display we are sorry that we didn't make more then 12 pieces. So for that we are glad to present the original Open Mic Forum Giclee fine art print that we maybe put on sale in a limited editon.

comments.author: fillippone
comments.body: I will be a very happy taker of this prize.I will contact you via DM to sort out the delivery. Thank you everyone for these beautiful gifts!

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Not sure if Event of the Year qualifies, but would be honored to have one of these.

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: Hello, thank you for these prizes!I hereby confirm that I am also interested in receiving the prize in physical form.

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: a very nice idea you have with the bca22 fine print and gives us the opportunity to also secure this artwork.some questions i still have and that is, from which region is the artwork sent and would there be the possibility to order directly also a matching frame (i know, it is offered here an unframed version but you can ask ) and the whole fine art print then framed to send?

comments.author: o_e_l_e_o
comments.body: Thank you for the very generous offer! Every year I am disappointed that I must decline the physical prizes due to my long held stance on privacy.Quote from: ChiBitCTy on February 17, 2023, 04:55:36 PMNot sure if Event of the Year qualifies, but would be honored to have one of these.Can I donate the cost of printing/shipping my print to making one for ChiBitCTy instead?

comments.author: AB de Royse777
comments.body: Thank you Cyrus for letting me know. I had hiccup but decided to be part of the special piece. Let me know what next to get it. Cheers,PS: Thanks everyone involved in the event including hosts and sponsors.

comments.author: TryNinja
comments.body: Quote from: o_e_l_e_o on February 18, 2023, 09:18:18 AMThank you for the very generous offer! Every year I am disappointed that I must decline the physical prizes due to my long held stance on privacy.Have you ever considered using a forwarding service to receive your packages? Then, AFAIK, your address and name aren't leaked to anyone but the company that will receive it and (re-)ship it to you.

comments.author: Cyrus
comments.created_time: February 19, 2023, 03:11:01 AMLast edit: February 19, 2023, 06:05:18 PM by Cyrus
comments.body: All the winners should have been contacted by now, thanks for confirming @fillippone, @GazetaBitcoin and @Royse777!Quote from: ChiBitCTy on February 17, 2023, 04:55:36 PMNot sure if Event of the Year qualifies, but would be honored to have one of these. Yes, it does! Would love create and send you the Event of the Year print.I don't think anybody would claim Fail of the Year print, but this is  Bitcointalk after all Quote from: cygan on February 18, 2023, 08:17:09 AMa very nice idea you have with the bca22 fine print and gives us the opportunity to also secure this artwork.some questions i still have and that is, from which region is the artwork sent and would there be the possibility to order directly also a matching frame (i know, it is offered here an unframed version but you can ask ) and the whole fine art print then framed to send?It's sent from the EU. Framing is possible and we've worked with with a great framing service in the past. This of course will increase the shipping cost.Quote from: o_e_l_e_o on February 18, 2023, 09:18:18 AMQuote from: ChiBitCTy on February 17, 2023, 04:55:36 PMNot sure if Event of the Year qualifies, but would be honored to have one of these.Can I donate the cost of printing/shipping my print to making one for ChiBitCTy instead?We're creating these on a confirmation basis, so if someone refuses (which is totally understandable!), there is no added cost to us. But we could consider that you donated yours to ChiBitCTy if it makes you happy

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Received my art prints yesterday. They are really nice!  The poster/paper used is high quality as well as the print itself.  If I'm reading this correctly likehiro created them?   Great job on them.  Again, thank you Cyrus, it's much appreciated!  These prints are fresh out of the tube and therefore need to be laid out/pressed to be able to take a good photo, so I did the best I could for the time being.  Once they are flattened out and I can take better photos I will also share those here.  Thanks again to all who were involved with this.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: ChiBitCTy on April 13, 2023, 09:38:54 PMReceived my art prints yesterday. They are really nice!  The poster/paper used is high quality as well as the print itself.  If I'm reading this correctly likehiro created them?   Great job on them.  Again, thank you Cyrus, it's much appreciated!  These prints are fresh out of the tube and therefore need to be laid out/pressed to be able to take a good photo, so I did the best I could for the time being.  Once they are flattened out and I can take better photos I will also share those here.  Thanks again to all who were involved with this.  I have read thru the thread a few times - I dont see where these can be bought but I might be too much of a simpleton - if there is a link can someone bold it or make it huge so I wont miss it lol

comments.author: Cyrus
comments.body: Quote from: ChiBitCTy on April 13, 2023, 09:38:54 PMReceived my art prints yesterday. They are really nice!  The poster/paper used is high quality as well as the print itself.  If I'm reading this correctly likehiro created them?   Great job on them.  Again, thank you Cyrus, it's much appreciated!  These prints are fresh out of the tube and therefore need to be laid out/pressed to be able to take a good photo, so I did the best I could for the time being.  Once they are flattened out and I can take better photos I will also share those here.  Glad you like them! Would love to see pictures from everyone, especially if you decide to frame it.As a general advice, if you decide to store it instead I recommend putting it back in the tube and avoid folding it as it will create creases.Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on April 14, 2023, 01:54:48 AMI have read thru the thread a few times - I dont see where these can be bought but I might be too much of a simpleton - if there is a link can someone bold it or make it huge so I wont miss it lolWell done, you made me re-read it a few times again to check if it's in any way confusing, edited to make sure This was our sponsor prize for the winners of BCA22, it's a custom 1 of 1 for each winner that wanted to claim it.And yes, we will soon announce a general edition of the print + a surprize item! bolded for emphasis

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: Cyrus on April 14, 2023, 02:30:47 AMQuote from: ChiBitCTy on April 13, 2023, 09:38:54 PMReceived my art prints yesterday. They are really nice!  The poster/paper used is high quality as well as the print itself.  If I'm reading this correctly likehiro created them?   Great job on them.  Again, thank you Cyrus, it's much appreciated!  These prints are fresh out of the tube and therefore need to be laid out/pressed to be able to take a good photo, so I did the best I could for the time being.  Once they are flattened out and I can take better photos I will also share those here.  Glad you like them! Would love to see pictures from everyone, especially if you decide to frame it.As a general advice, if you decide to store it instead I recommend putting it back in the tube and avoid folding it as it will create creases.Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on April 14, 2023, 01:54:48 AMI have read thru the thread a few times - I dont see where these can be bought but I might be too much of a simpleton - if there is a link can someone bold it or make it huge so I wont miss it lolWell done, you made me re-read it a few times again to check if it's in any way confusing, edited to make sure This was our sponsor prize for the winners of BCA22, it's a custom 1 of 1 for each winner that wanted to claim it.And yes, we will soon announce a general edition of the print + a surprize item! bolded for emphasis  what is bca22? is there a way to buy one?

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on April 14, 2023, 03:18:33 AM✂what is bca22? is there a way to buy one?bca stands for bitcointalk community rewards 👉 [Discussion] Bitcointalk Community Awards 🏆 and are led by icopressthese take place every year around november and the best users are searched in the following categories:Best ModeratorAntiheroHero of GoodDiscoveryBitcointalk NinjaWinnerSpamBusterMiss BitcointalkScamBusterBitcoin GeekGolden FeatherCraft Master

comments.author: TryNinja
comments.body: Finally got my print!It's gorgeous and very high quality. I was very surprised when I opened it. I'll try to put it on a frame.Thanks @Cyrus and the Cryptios team.
